definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: For such behavior is the second-oldest very puzzled.
sentences.chinese: 二老對於此行爲很是不解。

sentences.english: Sorry, I didn't know you were a straw boss.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，我不知道你是二老闆。

sentences.english: The whole family together to go to the railway station to answer the telephone, but wang zhen didnt make it.
sentences.chinese: 全家人一起去火車站接二老，唯有王喜貞沒有趕到。

sentences.english: Rich blessings for health and longevity is my wish for you in the coming year.
sentences.chinese: 祝二老在新的一年裏，身體健康，多福多壽。

sentences.english: You may also enjoy enjoy telephone.
sentences.chinese: 你二老也得享受享受啦。

sentences.english: Please two old very much take care the body.

definition: polite term for old woman or man
wife of father's elder brother/aunt/(polite form of address for a woman who is about the age of one's mother)/CL:個|个[ge4]
term of respect for your teacher's wife
my (you etc) old father/polite appellation for an elderly male
the younger generation/those who come after
great uncle/grandfather's younger brother/husband's father's younger brother
parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law/relatives by marriage
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
